summary: The 2016 Summer Olympics, called "Rio 2016," were held in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil, from August 5 to 21. It was the first Olympics in South America and a record 207 nations participated, including new teams like Kosovo and South Sudan. The Games featured 28 sports, with rugby sevens and golf added. Over 11,000 athletes competed for 306 sets of medals. The U.S. won the most gold (46) and total medals (121). Brazil, the host, had its best performance with 7 golds and 19 medals total. Many countries won their first-ever gold medals.
title: 2016 Summer Olympics
